channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #175 - Advent is here again!
item.description:
Hi,

First of all, let me apologize to those who are reading the text version of the newsletter. Due to a bug and my impatience, last the newsletter was missing the text version. Sorry for that.

Advent is here! While you might not celebrate the Christian Advent, it became a tradition in the Perl community to create Advent calendars. This means 24 articles in 24 days. We won't be able to cover all the articles published in the Advent calendars, but you can see a list of them in the Advent section. You can also follow the one maintained by Len Jaffe who has been collecting the various Advent calendars for years. Which brings me to another point. All of these calendars are written by volunteer contributors. Not necessarily core developers. You could also contribute an article!

Enjoy!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Perl Recruitment by a CPAN contributor
item.description: I'm a Perl programmer and open-source developer who also specialises in Perl recruitment in Europe. If you want to know if you're being paid enough, want some help with your CV, or just want to talk to a recruiter who knows the difference between 'local' and 'my', say hello at: http://perl.careers/.

item.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
item.description: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

item.title: Advent Planet 2014
item.description: Len Jaffe maintains and Advent calendar collecting the links to other advent calendars.

item.title: The State of Perl 6 in 2014
item.description: The first episode of the Perl 6 Advent calendar tells us that in 2014 MoarVM became the de facto standard backend of Rakudo and points us at a few more items in the expanding Perl 6 world.

item.title: Slicing and dicing your JSON (App::jpath)
item.description: This is the first episode in perlancar's 2014 Advent Calendar introducing to a selection of 24 modules he wrote in 2014.

item.title: No Room At The I.N.N.
item.description: This is sort of 'the' Perl Advent calendar. This article is about temporary directories.

item.title: Another year of Dancing...
item.description: After skipping a year, the Dancer developers have started publish the Advent calendar for 2014. Let's see if they bring in enough contributors.

item.title: Seoul.pm
item.description: Finally, if you are really serious, you could also follow the Advent Calendar of the Seoul Perl Mongers. In Korean.

item.title: Show CPANstats on every page
item.description: Passing values the the process method of Template::toolkit

item.title: Add another static page
item.description: Passing parameters to the template() function. Conditionals in Template::Toolkit.

item.title: More adventures in test failures
item.description: Sinan Unur keeps bumping into test failures while using perl 5.20.1 compiled with Visual Studio 2013 CE. I wonder if he is also sending bug-reports or even patches to fix these issues, or is he trying to get people understand the problems and fix them by themselves? Have you sent any patches (or pull requests) recently?

item.title: A curious case of a directory separator related test failure in Dancer2
item.description: This time the directory separators were returned incorrectly on Windows.

item.title: Can you send 24 pull requests this December?
item.description: The idea behind this project is to encourage you to contribute to an open source project every day. Even if each contribution is small, this can get you in the practice of contributing.

item.title: All about Mojolicious - interview of Sebastian Riedel part 1
item.description: Nikos Vaggalis looked at Mojolicious' history: why Sebastian left Catalyst for Mojolicious, present: what does the framework actually do, the project's future: Sebastian's long-term plans.

item.title: Gazelle - Plack Handler for performance freaks
item.description: Slides introducing Gazelle a web server for PSGI based we applications. In some cases as much as 3 times faster than Starman(!)

item.title: The 2015 CPAN pull request challenge
item.description: If the 24 pull requests in December challenge seems like to dense for you, this one can work. Neil promises to send you a CPAN module every month and you are expected to send a pull-request fixing some issue in that module. One every month in 2015.

item.title: RT for Incident Response 3.0.4 Released
item.description: Best Practical has release a new bugfix version of Request Tracker.

item.title: Comparing programmable tab completion in bash, zsh, tcsh, and fish
item.description: An overview of what you need to do if you'd like to get your program to provide tab completition in various Unix/Linux shells.

item.title: Macros: "Define Your Own Literals" Day
item.description: Embedding SQL in Perl 6 which is embedded in HTML which is embedded in Perl 6... It's just turtles all the way down. And interesting, or maybe horrific example of how slangs (dialects ?) can be embedded into each other with Perl 6.

item.title: (iv) CPAN great modules released last week
Length of an array in Perl
item.description: It might be obvious to many long-time Perl developer that 'length @array' does not return the number of elements in an array, but what doses it do? And how to get the length of an array?

item.title: Memory usage and load time of Moose, Moo, and Class::Accessor
item.description: In many applications either load time or memory usage is important. This articles shows the technique with 3 modules used for Object Oriented programming in Perl.
